title: Utf8b8jwjo4jw The Met Gets Meta
text:
Synopsis
Crypto is expanding beyond financial applications, with major cultural institutions like The Met and Hollywood exploring blockchain-powered interactive experiences that blur the lines between creators, audiences, and collectors.

Key Insights
- The Metropolitan Museum of Art launched Art Links, a blockchain-powered game on Base that rewards players with NFT badges and museum perks, recording nearly 20,000 plays in its first week
- Incention and Story Protocol are developing Emergence, a blockchain platform for collaborative storytelling that uses smart contracts to recognize and compensate creative contributions
- Chainalysis reports 4.52% of newly launched tokens in 2024 show patterns of pump-and-dump schemes
- Over 3 million tokens have been launched on Ethereum, Base, and BNB Chain, with only 1.7% showing active trading in the past 30 days
- 89% of suspected pump-and-dump schemes involve liquidity providers rugging their own pools
- Emerging DeFi and AI platforms (DeFAI) are developing more sophisticated trading interfaces, with DEX trading bots processing over $400m daily
